newsitem.title: USA: Justice Dept honors Ferber prosecutors.
newsitem.headline: Justice Dept honors Ferber prosecutors.

text.p: Attorney General Janet Reno honored the prosecutorial team that helped convict former municipal bond adviser Mark Ferber on fraud and corruption charges.
Assistant U.S. Attorneys Brien O'Connor, David Apfel and auditor Thomas Zapalla were given the John Marshall Award for Trial of Litigation for their work in the prosecution of Ferber.

Feber was convicted after a three-month trial on 58 separate fraud and corruption charges for the illicit contractual relations he forced with Merrill Lynch while a partner at Lazard Freres and acting as an advisor to municipal clients including the District of Columbia and the Massachusetts Water Resources Authority.
Ferber was sentenced to 33 months in prison and fined $1 million in December 1996.

The award also took notice of the trio's prosecution of both Merrill Lynch and Lazard which resulted in both firm's paying $24 million in fines - the largest sum in any Justice Department or Securities and Exchange Commission municipal securities matter, the agencies said.
Lazard has since left the municipal bond business.
